result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian M Lein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 8 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ian M Lein in court with attorney Brett A Ekes.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - Ct.1 - G.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.      Ct.2 - DRI.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$200+cc+DNA, 60 dtp, ftp 8 days RCJ for contempt.

  ***Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of the sentence.***
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.

Pre-trial conference at 11-19-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 12-21-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant, LPB.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ian M Lein in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl.  Defendant Ian M Lein in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
